Submodules¶

xierpa3.adapters.adapter module¶

class xierpa3.adapters.adapter.Adapter(root=None)¶

Bases: object

The Adapter classes connect the templates to content. Note that an adapter always a <b>Data</b> instance with attributes fields that fit the request. The caller needs to check if the requested fields really where filled. In case of an error the article.error field is holding the error message and the error fields are <b>None</b>. In case there is an unknown request, the output text is equal to the error message.

ARTICLECLASS¶

alias of Article

C¶

alias of Constants

get(contentID=None, **kwargs)¶

This get method is the core routine to make the adapter produce content. There is a dispatcher level to search for an adapter method that matches the contentID. All adapter method need to answer a Data instance, where the requested data is embedded as one of the attributes @(article.text, article.url, article.chapters)@.

getArticle(id=None, index=0, selector=None, order=None, **kwargs)¶

Answer the article, indicate by <b>id</b>. If <b>id</b> is <b>None</b> or omitted, then try to find the id the sort order of article ids at <b>index</b>.

getArticleIds(start=0, count=1, selector=None, order=None, **kwargs)¶

Answer the list article ids in the current sort order. To be redefined but inheriting adapter classes. Default behavior is the answer an list of index numbers from <b>start</b> to <b>start+count</b>. The <b>selector</b> and <b>order</b> indicate the kind of articles to be selected and the order in which they should be indexed.

getArticles(ids=None, start=0, count=1, selector=None, order=None, **kwargs)¶

Answer the articles as indicated by the arguments. There are several types of selection possible. <b>self.getArticles(count=4)</b> will answer the first 4 articles in the current sort order of articles. <b>self.getArticles(start=5, count=3)</b> will answer the articles with index 5, 6 and 7 in the current sort order of articles. <b>self.getArticles(ids=(‘aaa’, ‘bbb’, ‘ccc’))</b> will answer the articles with the indicated id in the defined order.

getChapter(index=0, **kwargs)¶

Answer the chapter with in index of the current article.

getChapters(**kwargs)¶

Answer a list of the selected article chapters.

getDescription()¶

Answer the description of the site (or page) to be used in the head.meta.description tag.

getFavIcon(**kwargs)¶
getFooter(**kwargs)¶
getKeyWords()¶

Answer the keywords of the site (or page) to be used in the head.meta.keywords tag.

getLogo(**kwargs)¶
getMobilePages(count=10)¶
getPageTitle(**kwargs)¶
getPages(count=10)¶
getSocialMedia(**kwargs)¶
getTagCloud(**kwargs)¶
initialize()¶

Optionally to be redefined by inheriting adapter classes. Default behavior is to do nothing.

classmethod newArticle(**kwargs)¶

To allow modification by inheriting classes, answer a new instance of Data.

xierpa3.adapters.adaptertester module¶

class xierpa3.adapters.adaptertester.AdapterTester¶

Bases: object

The AdapterTester is used to test the validity of the API of an adapter.

>>> from textilefileadapter import TextileFileAdapter
>>> from xierpa3.sites import doingbydesign
>>> # Root path where to find the article Simples wiki file for this example page.
>>> articleRoot = TX.module2Path(doingbydesign) + '/files/articles/'
>>> adapter = TextileFileAdapter(articleRoot)
>>> AdapterTester.test(adapter)

classmethod test(adapter)¶

classmethod testChapters(article)¶

xierpa3.adapters.blurbadapter module¶

class xierpa3.adapters.blurbadapter.BlurbAdapter¶

Bases: xierpa3.adapters.adapter.Adapter

The Adapter classes connect the templates to Blurb content. Note that an adapter always returns plain text/content elements (which can include plain HTML), not components. The conversion needs to be done by the calling component.

xierpa3.adapters.sqladapter module¶

class xierpa3.adapters.sqladapter.SQLAdapter(database_name, model=None)¶

Bases: xierpa3.adapters.adapter.Adapter

SQL_NOTDELETED = 'deleted is not TRUE'¶
getEmptySelection(table='item', fields=None, **args)¶
getModel()¶

Model of the database for Python representation and operation of data set. By default represent Item table only.

getRecord(table='item', id=None, readonly=True, data=None, fields=None, **args)¶

The <code>getRecord</code> method answers the result of <code>self._db.getRecord</code>. If <attr>id</attr> is not defined, then create a new record, using the optional <attr>args</attr> as values to initialize. If the record cannot be found, then answer an instance if <code>NoneRecord</code>.

getSelection(table=None, selector=None, where=None, order=None, slice=None, start=None, parentid=None, readonly=True, query=None, fields=None, deleted=False, andor='AND', selectall=False, *args, **kwargs)¶

The <code>getSelection</code> method is a front for <code>self._db.getSelection()</code>. The difference is that it allows three ways to defined the selection clause: <attr>**args</attr> is the dictionary of additional attributes that will be composed into an AND clause <attr>where</attr>, or the <attr>selector</attr> instance or the raw <attr>where</attr>. If one of these attributes is defined, then the value of the preceding ones are ignored.<br/>

openDatabase(database_name, model)¶
class xierpa3.adapters.sqladapter.Selector¶
class xierpa3.adapters.sqladapter.SqlDatastore¶

xierpa3.adapters.textilefileadapter module¶

class xierpa3.adapters.textilefileadapter.TextileFileAdapter(root=None)¶

Bases: xierpa3.adapters.adapter.Adapter

The TextileFileAdapter reads the articles from a tree of folder/text files, compiling the Textile source to HTML.

>>> from xierpa3.sites import doingbydesign
>>> # Root path where to find the article Simples wiki file for this example page.
>>> articleRoot = TX.module2Path(doingbydesign) + '/files/articles/'
>>> adapter = TextileFileAdapter(articleRoot)
>>> article = adapter.getArticle(id='index')
>>> article.title
u'Home'
>>> article.featured[0]
u'how-to-build-a-xierpa3-site'
>>> article = adapter.getArticle(id=article.featured[0])
>>> article.keys()[:4]
[u'author', 'blogresponse', u'category', u'featured']
>>> article.title
u'How to build a site with Xierpa3'
>>> article.featured[0]
u'example-hello-world'
>>> article.author
u'Petr van Blokland'
>>> article.topic
u'A basic course in building sites the easy way.'
>>> len(article.chapters)
1
>>> adapter.ranked[0]
[Article blogresponse, featured, id, modificationTime, path, ranking, source, tag, title, url]
>>> adapter.ranked[0].title
u'Categories'
>>> adapter.getIdPaths()[0]
('about', 'about.txt')
C¶

alias of Constants

CHAPTER_TAG = '=C='¶
COMMASPLIT = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object at 0x11033c6b0>¶

Adapter for Textile wiki file serving.

DATACLASS¶

alias of Article

FIELDVALUE = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object at 0x110337b70>¶
compileArticle(wiki)¶

Compile the wiki text into an Article instance, but parsing the field definition, split on chapters and translate the chapter content through textile to html. See specification on :http://redcloth.org/hobix.com/textile/

getArticle(**kwargs)¶

Answer the matching article, based on the available keywords in kwargs. The method will search in cached articles. If the file of the article changed, then it will be updated by compiling the Textile content again.

getArticleByIndex(index, selector=None)¶

Answer the article that is matching the index in sorting/selection of selector.

getArticleByUrl(url)¶

Answer the article that is matching url by one of the values in the @$url@ field. Answer @None@ if no matching article could be found.

getArticles(start=0, count=1, omit=None, **kwargs)¶

Answer the sorted list of count pages/articles, starting on start index, selected from all articles. Sorting is based om the @article.ranking@ field. If omit is a list of article ids (or a single id), then skip these articles from the selection.

getCachedArticle(**kwargs)¶

Answer the cached articles. If not available yet, read them through self.getPaths().

getCachedArticles()¶
getChapterByIndex(index, article)¶

Find the chapter by <b>index</b> in the Article instance <b>article</b>. Answer <b>None</b> if the chapter index is not valid.

getChapterTitleByIndex(index, article)¶

Find the title of the chapter by <b>index</b> in the Article instance <b>article</b>. Answer <b>None</b> if the index is not valid or the title cannot be found.

getChapters(article)¶
getFeaturedArticles(id, start, count)¶

Answer a list of featured articles in the article that has @id@ as identifier.

getFields()¶

Answer a @Article@ instance with dictionaries of all field names, related to lists of articles. Included @article.urls@, @article.categories@ and @article.levels@.

>>> from xierpa3.sites import doingbydesign
>>> # Root path where to find the article Simples wiki file for this example page.
>>> articleRoot = TX.module2Path(doingbydesign) + '/files/articles/'
>>> adapter = TextileFileAdapter(articleRoot)
>>> adapter.getFields()
[Article categories, levels, urls]
getIdPaths(path=None, idPaths=None)¶
getLogo(**kwargs)¶

For now, answer the default DbD logo.

>>> from xierpa3.sites import doingbydesign
>>> # Root path where to find the article Simples wiki file for this example page.
>>> articleRoot = TX.module2Path(doingbydesign) + '/files/articles/'
>>> adapter = TextileFileAdapter(articleRoot)
>>> adapter.getLogo()
[Article src, url]
getMenuArticles(**kwargs)¶

Answer an ordered list of the menu articles, as indicated by the selectors id or other values in kwargs. Normally this will be the @home@ page of the site, containing the main menu options in @$menu@. The @article.pages@ are article article instances where the menu points to.

>>> from xierpa3.sites import doingbydesign
>>> # Root path where to find the article Simples wiki file for this example page.
>>> articleRoot = TX.module2Path(doingbydesign) + '/files/articles/'
>>> adapter = TextileFileAdapter(articleRoot)
>>> menuArticles = adapter.getMenuArticles(id='index')
>>> for article in menuArticles:
...     article.id
'articles'
'products'
'courses'
'about'
getMobilePages(count=None, **kwargs)¶
getPageTitle(**kwargs)¶
getRankedArticles()¶

Answer the dictionary of articles, sorted by rank.

initialize()¶
keys()¶
>>> from xierpa3.sites import doingbydesign
>>> # Root path where to find the article Simples wiki file for this example page.
>>> articleRoot = TX.module2Path(doingbydesign) + '/files/articles/'
>>> adapter = TextileFileAdapter(articleRoot)
>>> sorted(adapter.keys())[0]
'about'
classmethod readWikiFile(fsPath)¶

Read the raw wiki (Textile syntax) file and answer the unicode string.

updateArticle(id, path)¶

Update the article from id and path. Set the modification time, so we know when the file is updated.
